name: USA Stay Hotel and Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean hotel with friendly people. Breakfast needs work - hot water not hot to brew tea. Had tour group and they took over the hotel. A little insulted by the blue wash cloth for women to use to wash their faces ( they can't get the white ones clean?).
reviews.title: probably the best in town

likes.disliked: — hard to deal with tour group there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This looked to be quite a new hotel and at our budget of just under $100 we booked in. We found it to be very good, clean and very welcoming.A visit to the Mammoth site just across the road was very interesting and well worth the trip.
reviews.title: A welcome stop

reviews.text: A very good breakfast in the morning with waffles and all the usual cereals.
reviews.title: Spacious room for reasonable price!

likes.liked: — The big room and the nice price.

reviews.text: We traveled with our extended family of eight to South Dakota. This was a very nice hotel. The front desk staff was excellent and they had to deal with my brother, step-father, and I all talking over each other, and fighting over who was going to pay for the rooms!
reviews.title: Best Stop of our Trip

likes.disliked: — No pool, but remember Evan's Pluge is just up the street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no pool at the hotel, but we spent the day at Evan's Plunge so that was not an issue. It is right across the street from the Mammoth Site! The breakfast area is large and very roomy.
reviews.title: Nice overnight

likes.liked: — Close to Mount Rushmore and Custard State Park

reviews.text: It was a good stay. I really like Holiday Inn Express!
reviews.title: What A Great Place to Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was a basic Holiday Inn Express. We had traveled all day and needed some relaxation. We fixed a couple of drinks and went to the hot tub. The jets on the hot tub did not work and then there was a sign that no alcohol was allowed, O well. We drank our drinks as we sat in the hot water and went to bed.
reviews.title: Good HI Express

reviews.text: It's slighltly further removed from the actual town of Hot Springs than other properties, as it's (the only one) located on the bypass.
reviews.title: Perfectly fine hotel.

reviews.text: No complaints about this Holiday Inn Express: You will get exactly what you expect from this property.
reviews.title: You can feel good about making a reservation here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No pool, but they have an indoor hot tub. Next door to a "family fun" type center.
reviews.title: Very Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on the Hot Springs Bypass, this was a quiet, very nice hotel. The room was quite clean, the linens and pillows comfortable, the bed excellent. All staff exceptionally pleasant & helpful. Essentially full breakfast, kept well stocked. The hot tub was exactly that - HOT. Great if you like it that way! No complaints at all about our stay here, would definitely stay here another time.
reviews.title: Great NEW Hotel...Loved it....

likes.liked: — New...very clean...quiet hotel. Good price & good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This a a very nice, affordable hotel. It was clean and we had a large room. Other reviews had stated that their was a smoke smell in the room. Our room was smoke free. The breakfast was great. Eggs, biscuits and homemade gravy. (At least we were told it was homemade.) A good hotel.
reviews.title: Good Choice

description: 86 room hotel located in the beautiful southern Black Hills. Close to all attractions.
